title: International body verifies Vedanta Aluminium products as environmentally sustainable - PR Newswire
summary: Vedanta Aluminium has received the Environmental Product Declaration (EPD) International verification for its range of primary aluminium products, showcasing its commitment to sustainable manufacturing practices in the aluminium industry.
green_innovation: TRUE. This article describes Vedanta Aluminium's commitment to achieving sustainable manufacturing practices in the aluminium industry, emphasizing energy efficiency, greenhouse gas reduction, water conservation, and waste management.
business_innovation: TRUE. Vedanta Aluminium's achievement of the Environmental Product Declaration (EPD) International verification for its range of products demonstrates a significant improvement in its manufacturing processes, aligning with the definition of business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. Vedanta Aluminium's primary aluminium products, verified by EPD, are designed and manufactured with a focus on reducing environmental impact throughout their life cycle, fulfilling the criteria of a green product.
green_process: TRUE. The article highlights Vedanta Aluminium's advanced manufacturing practices and green innovations aimed at ensuring sustainability across the aluminium value chain, thus meeting the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 331313 - Alumina Refining and Primary Aluminum Production, 331314 - Secondary Smelting and Alloying of Aluminum, 331315 - Aluminum Sheet, Plate, and Foil Manufacturing, 331318 - Other Aluminum Rolling, Drawing, and Extruding
greenwashing: FALSE. The article highlights Vedanta Aluminium's genuine commitment to sustainable manufacturing practices and the receipt of the Environmental Product Declaration (EPD) International verification, demonstrating transparency and environmental responsibility.

title: Microalgae-based decarbonization project to deliver sustainable products to the value chain - Aquafeed.com
summary: The article discusses a project by Danish startup Algiecel which aims to use CO2, power, and microalgae for decarbonization, generating biomass for industries like aquafeeds. The project partners include Novozymes, DTU Chemical Engineering, Knowledge Hub Zealand, and Power to Climate Change, with a focus on converting CO2 to bio-based products and promoting sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is a green innovation as it involves utilizing CO2, power, and microalgae for decarbonization, generating biomass sustainably, and demonstrating the conversion of CO2 to valuable downstream products for various industries.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article primarily focuses on green innovation and sustainability efforts rather than introducing new products or processes that significantly differ from the firm's previous offerings in the market.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses the production of biomass for industries like aquafeeds using environmentally benign materials, sustainable processes, and recycled nutrients, aligning with the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE. The article describes methods for minimizing environmental impacts, recycling nutrients, and utilizing renewable resources in the production of biomass and bio-oil, aligning with the concept of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 221119 - Other Electric Power Generation, 325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 541712 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences, 541713 - Research and Development in Biotechnology
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit any characteristics of greenwashing; instead, it focuses on genuine efforts towards eco-friendly innovations and sustainability.

title: The Toyota Production System: A Fresh Look - Assembly Magazine
summary: The article discusses the Toyota Production System (TPS) as a multidisciplinary science impacting various processes and highlighting its relevance beyond the automotive industry. It emphasizes TPS's principles of combining craftsmanship and mass production for efficiency, quality, and waste reduction through innovative managerial and technical approaches.
green_innovation: FALSE, The article primarily focuses on the Toyota Production System (TPS) and its operational and managerial aspects within the manufacturing context, without a primary emphasis on environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, The article discusses how the Toyota Production System (TPS) introduces significant changes in manufacturing and transactional processes, showcasing a new and improved way of managing operations and enhancing efficiency.
green_product: FALSE, While the article touches upon Toyota's production of hybrid, electric, and hydrogen engines aligning with the global need for clean energy, the main focus is on the efficiency and operational aspects of the Toyota Production System (TPS), rather than the specific design, manufacture, and use of environmentally friendly products.
green_process: FALSE, The article details the Toyota Production System (TPS) approach to manufacturing, focusing on operational methods such as one-piece continuous flow and the 'stop and notify' method to enhance efficiency and reduce waste within a production system, rather than emphasizing the wider concept of green processes that minimize environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 336111 - Automobile Manufacturing, 541614 - Process, Physical Distribution, and Logistics Consulting Services, 541614 - Process, Physical Distribution, and Logistics Consulting Services, 611430 - Professional Employer Organizations
greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not focus on making false or misleading environmental claims about products or practices (greenwashing); instead, it discusses the operational and managerial aspects of the Toyota Production System (TPS) and its broader impact on the manufacturing industry.

title: How Recycling Technology is Helping the Brands in the Footwear Industry - Indian Retailer
